Major_Arcs.title: Circus Arrival and Paul Bunyan's Introduction
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Paul Bunyan and the arrival of the circus, establishing the initial setting and characters.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Performance and Town Excitement
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers Paul Bunyan's impressive circus act and the townspeople's enthusiastic reaction to the circus's arrival.

Major_Arcs.title: The Conflict with Grasso and Paul Bunyan's New Role
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the escalating conflict with Matto Grasso, Paul Bunyan's intervention, and his subsequent recruitment into the circus.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Initial Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene follows the investigation into sounds of trouble and the initial confrontation with Billings/Grasso, leading to a physical brawl and escalating threats.

sub_scenes.title: Recruitment and New Identity
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the encounter with the circus owner, the backstory of Grasso, and the recruitment of the strong man as the new 'Paul Bunyan'.

Major_Arcs.title: Grasso's Revenge and Bunyan's Heroics
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Matto Grasso's attempts to sabotage Paul Bunyan's success and Paul Bunyan's heroic interventions to save the circus.

sub_scenes.title: Envy, Sabotage, and Fire
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Grasso's envy and plot for revenge, culminating in setting the circus tent on fire and Paul Bunyan's intervention.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Acclaim and Grasso's Envy

sub_scenes.title: Ape Escape and The Chase
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Grasso's new plan involving releasing Gigantico the ape, Paul Bunyan's response, and the chase that ensues.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Arena and New Plan
Bucket as a Trick and Continued Escape
The Turn to Fight and Capture
The Trapeze Toss and Audience Reaction

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Tibetan Adventure
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Marco Polo and his adventures, focusing on his encounter with the Ogress of Tibet and related mystical events.

sub_scenes.title: Ogress Encounter and Talking Head
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins with Marco Polo's encounter with the Ogress and transitions to a man on horseback discovering a talking severed head in the forest.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo's Encounter with the Ogress

sub_scenes.title: Magical Dagger and Mourning City
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene involves the man on horseback receiving a magical dagger and then arriving at a city in mourning.

narrative_arcs.title: The Sacred Dagger and Debt Repayment
The Question of the Knife's Inaction and Farewell

sub_scenes.title: Princess Lotus and the Witch's Castle
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Marco Polo's arrival in Hi-toun, the King's grief over Princess Lotus, Marco's offer to help, and his encounter with a cloaked woman leading him to a witch's castle.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo's Arrival and Royal Welcome
The King's Grief and Princess Lotus's Disappearance
A Plea from a Starving Woman
Entering the Mysterious Castle and Strange Children
Confrontation with Monstrous Mice and Sword Drawn
Discovery of the Special Knife and Hope
Escape from the Dungeon with the Magic Knife
Arrival and the Misunderstanding of Black Drapes

Major_Arcs.title: The Tale of Treasure and Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc presents a story within the comic, narrated by a Treasure Keeper, about treasure, betrayal, and revenge in a penal colony.

sub_scenes.title: Prologue and Penal Colony Setting
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets up the treasure tale with a prologue and then transitions to the setting of a British penal colony.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Resolution at Brooking's Home
Journey to the Attic and Treasure Reveal
Police Investigate Shot and Discover Body

Major_Arcs.title: Dr. Styx and the Haunted Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Dr. Styx and his involvement in investigating a haunted estate, dealing with supernatural entities and past crimes.

sub_scenes.title: Ominous Introduction and Courtroom Sentence
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Dr. Styx in a menacing context and then shifts to a courtroom where Vincent Matthews is sentenced to death.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Attack and Claim of Power
Questioning Violence and Shifting Power Dynamics
Confession of Fear and Societal Position
The Solution of Forgiveness and Love
The Revelation of Rosalind and the Murder
Demand for Brotherly Love and Release

Major_Arcs.title: Henry Hudson's Voyages and Mutiny
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc chronicles Henry Hudson's voyages to find the Northwest Passage, culminating in mutiny and his unknown fate.

sub_scenes.title: Hudson's Ambition and Initial Voyage
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Henry Hudson's story and his initial commission by the Dutch East India Company to find the Northwest Passage.

narrative_arcs.title: The Enigma of Henry Hudson's Fate
The Dutch East India Company's Proposition
Rising Tensions and a Turn Southward
Entering the Hudson River with Hope
Hudson's Resignation and Decision to Return
Another Voyage Backed by a New Company
Trapped in Ice and Winter Quarters
The Ice Melts and Disagreement Over Course
Scuffle and Ousting of Captain Hudson
Captain Hudson Set Adrift and Mutineers' Departure

Major_Arcs.title: Hassan the Arabian Knight and the Rescue Mission
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Hassan the Arabian Knight on his mission to rescue a kidnapped woman from Tartar horsemen.

sub_scenes.title: The Chase and the Caliph's Request
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene starts with Hassan in a chase and then explains the mission given to him by the Caliph to rescue a kidnapped woman.

narrative_arcs.title: Summoned by the Caliph for a Rescue Mission
Setting off to Confront the Tartars
Inside the Tartar Camp and Confirmation of the Daughter
Detection and Confrontation by Tartar Soldiers
The Signal and the Start of the Contest
Dirt as a Weapon and Initial Attack
Exploiting the Advantage and Close Combat
